title: New lore: Runeterra map concept #3
body:
Am I annoying already? xD

Some things polished out, the "third continent" is more separate.

Also please consider the Runeterra's (I mean the planet) curvature, which is surpassed, so the northern part might look way larger than it is. I placed the prime meridian into Piltover, because they are the most likely to discover meridians and stuff like this.

http://i.imgur.com/bPFbJ5Uh.jpg

Map #2: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/8qWgBuq9-new-lore-runeterra-map-concept-2

1. In the new universe site they say that Piltover is built ontop of Zaun. They where the same city befor but now they have become two seporate citys. Zaun is the underworld of Piltover. They are still different citys but they are on the same place on the map because they are stacked ontop of each other.

2. I can't find Icathia on the map. Icathia is located on the same continent as Shurima but we don't exactly know where. I think Icathia is located in the north part of the Shurima desert. Kinda like Urtistan is in the South-west I think Icathia is in the north-east.

This map is great and really do help everyone to get a better idea of where everything is located. Good job!

Thank you :)

It wont take you 30 days to get from point A to point B if the distance between point A and B are longer or shorter, it will take you longer or shorter time to traverse. 

If we take the notion that the cart travels the same speed regardless of other outside forces constantly during each travel, then the time needed to pass X distance is different than passing Y distance (Y=X+N, N being a difference in distance).

And given the fact that we have 12 seas on Runeterra, some of them have to be placed somewhere (and ifs only seas instead of seas and oceans, that means the land masses are close enough to each other to not create large bodies of water as oceans are classified as). I could also speculate that one or two seas are at least located at the northern part of the planet, and if theres nothing bellow Kumungu, you have the south seas.
Might be even smaller, let'say, Black or Caspian sea.
